problem_text:
Let n be a positive integer. For a finite group K and an automorphism ϕ of K of order dividing n, let Xn,ϕ(K) := {x ∈ K | xxϕ · · · xϕn−1 = 1}. Let cn be the supremum of the ratios |Xn,ϕ(H)|/|H| over all finite groups H and their automorphisms ϕ ∈ Aut(H) such that ϕn = id and Xn,ϕ(H) ̸= H.
(a) Let n > 1 be a positive integer such that cd < 1 for all prime power divisors d of n. Is it true that cn < 1?
(b) For a finite group G and a positive integer n, the generalized Hughes–Thompson subgroup is defined as Hn(G) = ⟨x ∈ G | xn ̸= 1⟩. Suppose that n is a positive integer for which there is a positive integer kn depending only on n such that |G : Hn(G)| ⩽ kn for all finite groups G with Hn(G) ̸= 1. Is it true that then cn < 1? This question is open even when n ⩾ 5 is prime.
A. Abdollahi, M. S. Malekan
